page.title: 20HINTON & PILLS MOORS & LODGE
page.content:
{THE MOORS.}In 1086 these moors were common land of the Royal Manor of Wimborne. After the enclosures they remained common land with various people and institutions holding grazing rights. In 1948 these rights were no longer economic so a management committee was formed which now lets the use of the moors to local right holders for a rent which is then apportioned to the right holders in lieu of rights.
{BADBURY LODGE.}This dates from the late 15th or early 16th cent. It was probably built using the derelict manor house as a quarry. Its purpose was as a royal hunting lodge on the southern edge of Cranborne Chase as the manor house had moved to Canford, too far from the hunting. It is now held by the National Trust.
